practices.title: Practice I: Problem solving activities and resources
practices.description: From the listed activities, select all those you carry out on the Internet when you need to solve problems during a programming task:

actions.title: 1) Ask questions to other developers
2) Share and/or discuss coding items, source code, specifications and/or new ideas
3) Find and assess information on the web to solve problems during a project or task.
4) Check out code components (snippets), software libraries or plugins to reuse, adapt and integrate them.
5) Check out tutorials, online courses, webinars or e-learning platforms.
6) Other

practices.title: Practice II: Staying up to date activities and resources
practices.description: From the listed activities, select all those you carry out on the Internet when you want to stay up to date with the latest trends in the software industry:

actions.title: 1) Track changes in ongoing open source projects
2) Seek out other developers’ comments, issues or discussions.
3) Seek out interesting or important news, announcements or events.
4) Seek out other developers’ reflections or ideas.
5) Check out tutorials, online courses, webinars or e-learning platforms.
6) Monitor job openings descriptions and requirements.
7) Other

practices.title: Practice III: Deliberate learning activities and resources
practices.description: From the listed activities, select all those you carry out on the Internet when you want to learn something new about software development:

actions.title: 1) Track and assess changes in ongoing open source projects.
2) Develop and submit contributions to software projects.
3) Seek out other developers’ discussions, issues, comments, reflections or ideas.
4) Share comments, reflections or ideas about news or topics you want to learn.
5) Participate in discussions about topics or issues you want to learn.
6) Ask questions to other developers
7) Answer questions from other developers
8) Share and/or discuss coding items, source code, specifications and/or new ideas.
9) Check out code components (snippets), software libraries or plugins to reuse, adapt and integrate them.
10) Check out tutorials, online courses, webinars or e-learning platforms.
11) Document your own coding activity and work in text, audio or video.
12) Other

practices.title: Practice IV: Career Management Activities and Resources
practices.description: From the listed activities, select all those you of the following activities you carry out on the Internet when you want to manage your career as a computer and software engineer:

actions.title: 1) Develop and submit contributions to software projects.
2) Share references on something you are working on or learning, relevant news, or events you are participating in.
3) Contribute to specialized software communities by answering other developers questions or moderating discussions.
4) Share content that documents your work, reflections or ideas.
5) Participate in online courses, webinars, events or e-learning platforms that provide some form of certification or verifiable record.
6) Other

demographics.title: a) Do you have any software development experience before entering your program?
d) What software development languages can you currently work with?
In what university are you currently taking your bachelor?
